channel.title: Linux Outlaws
channel.description: Two pragmatic geeks talk about the latest news concerning Linux, free and open technology or anything else they deem noteworthy which may include such absurd things as hockey or bands you never heard of. This means there's many a joke and derailed conversation along the way, so don't come here expecting only Linux or software freedom talk — just sit back and relax, partner.
channel.itunes:author: Sixgun Productions
channel.itunes:subtitle: The hardest-hitting Linux podcast around
channel.itunes:summary: Two pragmatic geeks talk about the latest news concerning Linux, free and open technology or anything else they deem noteworthy which may include such absurd things as hockey or bands you never heard of. This means there's many a joke and derailed conversation along the way, so don't come here expecting only Linux or software freedom talk — just sit back and relax, partner.

item.title: Linux Outlaws 234 - Quick Wee
item.description:
Released: October 22, 2011
Length: 1:57:47

New Ubuntu is released, RIP Dennis Ritchie, a Beefy Miracle, ICANN rescues the Unix time zone database, Fab reviews the new Amazon Kindle and much more.


0:02:22 Introduction

  • Please submit news stories for the show only to Reddit not via email
  • German government malware discussion — Fab called this one pretty early
  • Minecraft is getting dragons
  • Dragon Age Redemption (written by and starring Felicia Day)
  • Beer: Samuel Smith Taddy Porter

Fabolympia by Nas

0:21:56 Releases and News

  • Ubuntu 11.10 “Oneiric Ocelot” as well as Kubuntu, Xubuntu, Edubuntu, Mythbuntu, Ubuntu Studio, Lubuntu and Ubuntu Rescue Remix
  • Sabayon Linux 7
  • FreeNAS 8.0.2
  • Owncloud 2
  • Subversion 1.7
  • Dennis Ritchie, inventor of the C language and UNIX pioneer, has died
  • WineHQ database compromised
  • Fedora 17 named “Beefy Miracle”
  • ICANN is taking over the Olson time zone database
  • Samba now accepts corporate-copyrighted code
  • Google Dart and C++ 11 released
  • HP shipped TouchPads with Android by mistake?
  • LibreOffice working on mobile and web versions of the office suite

1:05:04 Microwatch

  • Microsoft creates “browser security site” and ….uh.... says all other browsers are insecure
  • The Registry is alive and well in Windows 8
  • XBox accounts hacked in connection with FIFA games

Fab's Car by Nas

1:13:23 Review

Fab reviews the new Amazon Kindle.

  • Video review of the new Kindle
  • Fab's pictures on Google+

1:27:04 Feedback

Supporters: Remy van Elst and Solurity, Inc. — on Flattr: cyberkiller, johanv, cwoollard and the people who flattr us via a subscription

  • Michiel Beijen sent us a nice email about T-Dose, a technical open source conference in Eindhoven
  • Paul van der Loo shares Fab's pain about patronising cars
  • B1ackCr0w tells us about the new version of Tonidoplug
  • Evgeny Kuznetsov sent us some stories about copyright enforcement in Russia after our GEMA discussion
  • Remy Van Elst sent a link to a video of a Bruce Schneier talk
  • An anonymous emailer just sent one sentence: “Start a Linux Outlaws book club”

Bruce is insecure

We had other emails from John Artman, Brent Huisman, Roberto Arroyo, Jason, Lee Harr, Bernd Schlapsi and PsykoNerd.

Song: Occupy Wall Street (We're Gonna Stay Right Here) by David Rovics

Copyright © 2011 Sixgun Productions — except where otherwise noted, this show and all its accompanying content is licensed under Creative Commons BY-SA 3.0.

item.title: Linux Outlaws 233 - The All-New Ford Outlaw
item.description:
Released: October 16, 2011
Length: 1:28:36

German government malware, next Ubuntu version gets named, Ubuntu to power HP's cloud, Unix time zone database threatened, Nuance buys Swype and much more.


0:01:37 Introduction

  • Our thoughts and best wishes go out to Andy C, long-time friend of the show
  • A quick video review of the Minecraft Pocket Edition
  • If you need kickass web design done, corenominal is your man
  • Fab’s take on Steve Jobs

0:15:51 Releases and News

  • Development: Fedora 16 Beta
  • CyanogenMod 7.1
  • US drones hit by keylogger virus
  • EU Green Party adopts Pirate Party policy on copyright
  • Italian Wikipedia goes dark after law threatens to outlaw wikis
  • GEMA tries to collect royalties for Creative Commons music
  • Chaos Computer Club analyses German federal-sanctioned malware
  • Next Ubuntu version named “Precise Pangolin”
  • Rackspace aims to spin off OpenStack into a foundation
  • HP’s cloud to be powered by Ubuntu
  • Nonprofit Unix time zone database shut down after lawsuit
  • Dave Neary about Tizen: What Community?
  • Nuance buys Swype

Arnie's Bronze Statues

1:02:25 Microwatch

  • EU approves Skype deal

1:04:41 Feedback

Supporters: Stewart Danziger, Jeffrey Kaplan and Matthew Mactyre — on Flattr: cyberkiller, variaatio, corenominal and bobobex

  • Armin Krauss sent us this story about Siegfried Kauder
  • Nickolas Larsson from Sweden says he enjoys the show and also sent us a somewhat random picture of a road
  • Toby Newman sent us a link to this Horus/Horace-related picture
  • Toby Meehan wrote in with some opinions about Secure Boot for Windows
  • Matthias tells us his opinion about LPI exams

We had other emails from Mervin McDougall, alotsof, Max F., Tony Ciak and Lowe Schmidt.

Song: Sudo Modprobe (Bootstrap Version) by Rick Bragg (licensed Creative Commons BY-SA 3.0)

Copyright © 2011 Sixgun Productions — except where otherwise noted, this show and all its accompanying content is licensed under Creative Commons BY-SA 3.0.

item.title: Linux Outlaws 232 - This is Not Going Anywhere
item.description:
Released: October 8, 2011
Length: 1:35:41

Amazon launches all-new Kindles including an Android tablet, HTC suffers a massive security problem with their Sense UI, MeeGo is now officially dead, Red Hat buys Gluster, Samsung signs on to Microsoft's protection racket and Apple breaks its website on the day of their iPhone announcement.


0:01:27 Introduction

  • Video: Warhammer 40K lore in about a minute
  • Please use submit.lxnews.org to submit stories for the show from now on
  • Bunch of Creepers is back! 
  • The GoOSe project launches
  • We talk about Lightroom alternatives for Linux, including Darktable

0:14:45 Releases and News

  • ArchBang Linux 2011.10
  • FreeNAS 8.0.1
  • Firefox 7
  • PulseAudio 1.0
  • Gnome 3.2
  • Massive security vulnerability in Sense UI discovered — HTC now scrambling to fix this
  • Kernel.org is restored
  • Amazon releases new Kindles: Kindle Fire tablet, $99 Kindle Touch, new baseline Kindle is now $79 with ads, the Kindle 3 will be sold as “Kindle Keyboard”  — in-depth review at Ars Technica
  • Amazon says: We expect people will root these new devices

The Amazon Kindle Fire

  • MeeGo is dead, reborn as “Tizen”
  • Berlios is closing down
  • Humble Frozen Synapse Bundle
  • AirMech, a game built completely with open source tools
  • Blender Institute launches Project Mango
  • LibreOffice now one year old, still going strong
  • Sony Ericsson is supporting Android modders
  • Red Hat buys GlusterFS

1:09:25 Microwatch

  • Samsung signs on to Microsoft’s Android protection racket
  • Microsoft finally kills the Zune

1:15:46 Feedback

Supporters: Drew Fitzsimmons, Remy van Elst and Evgeny Kuznetsov — on Flattr: cwoollard, corenominal, johanv and deejay1

  • We got lots of responses about Linux alternatives to Lightroom, including from Jeremy Pope and Stefan Peter
  • Shlomo in Israel wrote us on the subject of podcatchers, which involves using his own script on his computer and Dropsync on his phone
  • Aitor Pazos sends us some informaton about El Partido de Internet (The Internet Party) in Spain and the plans they have to encourage citizens to participate in a more direct manner in the political system; they are developing a software tool for this called Agora (Launchpad page)
  • VulcanRidr and Bob send us some opinions on Windows 8 — review video
  • SmokeyMaverick says all US citizens should sign this petition against software patents on the White House site

We had other emails from Robert Berger, Michiel Beijen, Amir Taaki, Armin Krauss and our old friend Kevan V.

Song: Behind the Barricades by David Rovics (licensed Creative Commons BY-NC-SA 3.0) — playing this again as per special request by supporter Remy van Elst

Copyright © 2011 Sixgun Productions — except where otherwise noted, this show and all its accompanying content is licensed under Creative Commons BY-SA 3.0.

item.title: Linux Outlaws 231 - Engage the Noise Gate!
item.description:
Released: October 3, 2011
Length: 1:34:59

Gamers help fight HIV, Firefox is talking about a long term support version, Microsoft is trying to prevent you from booting Linux in the name of security and much more.


0:03:16 Introduction

  • Book tip: Horus Rising by Dan Abnett
  • Thanks to Matthew Mactyre for sending Fab a copy of Becky Hogge’s book Barefoot Into Cyberspace as a Kindle gift
  • Dan had an incredible time at PyConUK and would like to thank John Pinner of Linux Emporium
  • Google+ is now open to all and Hangout broadcasting has launched for selected partners
  • Check out this video of the Minecraft Pocket Edition touch controls
  • Jezra tried Katy's chili sauce recipe

Jezra after his scientific chili experiment

0:17:40 Releases and News

  • Tiny Core 4.0
  • Pardus 2011.2
  • IPCop 2.0.0
  • Banshee 2.2.0
  • OpenShot 1.4
  • Gamers discover protein that may help in the fight against HIV
  • Work ongoing to restore kernel.org
  • Firefox might get a long term support version

Foldit

0:40:20 Microwatch

  • Windows 8 logo specs might prevent Linux booting
  • Microsoft: If you insist on running "older operating systems", we’ll let you
  • Australian Linux users threaten Microsoft with consumer commission action

0:56:07 Feedback

Supporters: Lynn Steenson — on Flattr: bhuron, jatoo, tristan_2468, johanv, variaatio, corenominal and deejay1

Important notice: We changed the forum signup procedure. Please listen to the show for details.

  • David Will comments on Google+ about Fab's analysis of Windows 8
  • Jesper asks us about careers in Linux and says we should do a show for new users — we recommend Linux Reality and Going Linux
  • Kevin Granade works for a company that builds aircraft equipment and he tells us more about Linux on planes
  • Alotsof likes the show and discusses podcast listening habits, including speeding up the playback
  • Jonathan Nadeau (our Accessibility Correspondent) writes in about the accessibility features of Trisquel, which he helped work on

We had other emails from Mark Horsley, Tony Bemus, Lynn Ux, Chris Woollard and Robert P.

Song: This Race by You Me Tree (licensed under Creative Commons BY-NC-SA 3.0)

Copyright © 2011 Sixgun Productions — except where otherwise noted, this show and all its accompanying content is licensed under Creative Commons BY-SA 3.0.

item.title: Linux Outlaws 230 - Wait, There's the Ice Cream Van
item.description:
Released: September 24, 2011
Length: 1:44:04

Fab loses his hair, the Pirate Party scores big time in Germany, Google+ gets an API, identi.ca gets upgraded and Microsoft goes completely insane with Windows 8. Also: Arrrrrr!


0:01:48 Introduction

  • Fab's dreads are no more

  • Errata: Fab's BeyondPod unlock key also works for the tablet version... once he had installed it — D’oh!
  • Space Marine review
  • Four years of Linux Outlaws!
  • Thanks to Olli from Red Hat for sending Fab a ThinkPad and saving the show!
  • Nice article on Arch Linux
  • Project Gutenberg founder passes away
  • Beer: Karhu III from Finland

0:15:11 Releases and News

  • ArchBang Linux 2011.09
  • OpenIndiana oi_151a
  • Scientific Linux 5.7
  • KNOPPIX 6.7.1
  • pfSense 2.0
  • Trisquel GNU/Linux 5.0
  • OpenSSH 5.9
  • Apache 2.2.21
  • PostgreSQL 9.1
  • The Pirate Party scores 8.9% in Berlin and gets 15 seats in the local parliament
  • Linux Foundation servers compromised
  • Google+ gets an API and a new developers.google.com site
  • Meanwhile, identi.ca has been down all weekend for an upgrade to StatusNet 1.0
  • Monthly release proposed for Ubuntu
  • Boeing to base Dreamliner entertainment system on Android
  • Mozilla launches badges project?

1:01:06 Microwatch

  • Windows 8: Microsoft basically contends that the desktop is dead
  • Metro-style IE 10 won’t have plugins
  • Microsoft is rapidly losing web server market share

1:13:26 Feedback

Supporters: Neal Quincey, David Hills, Jeff Gehlbach, Remy van Elst, Kai Siers and the awesome people who flattr’d us

  • Tailzer wants us to promote Southend On Sea LUG
  • We also mention netelug
  • Whym comments on our discussion on Steve Jobs resigning and sents us lots of stuff on Apple history: Jef Raskin (Wikipedia), video of Steve Jobs unveiling the original Mac, Woz interview on Lifehacker, Tim Cook's letter to Apple staff, Jobs and Apple philantropy
  • Anthony in Dublin sent a story link about the ongoing Google / Oracle patent war, he also mentioned the Raspberry Pi project
  • Dan Goldstein sent us some info about his Open Source podcatcher Podax
  • Remy tells us about the Inferno OS running on Android
  • Alison Chaiken talks about SCALE 10x and the fact that she's driving a bus down there from the Bay Area, also: the call for papers for SCALE is now open

We had other emails this week from Dafydd, Kevin McDaniel, Peter King, Tom Link, Jake and Xavier Sythe.

  • Dan will be at PyCon UK this weekend

Song: Sailor Ain't A Sailor by the Port Isaac's Fisherman's Friends (all rights reserved, played by permission)

Copyright © 2011 Sixgun Productions — except where otherwise noted, this show and all its accompanying content is licensed under Creative Commons BY-SA 3.0.

item.title: Linux Outlaws 229 - The Windows of Linux Podcasts
item.description:
Released: September 16, 2011
Length: 1:22:15

More trouble in MeeGo land, Oracle stops distributing Java for Linux, rumours about the Amazon tablet, reviews of awesome podcatchers for your desktop, your phone and your tablet and much more.


0:01:32 Introduction

  • Jules Mudkips came up with our new podcast slogan: “We podcast for Macragge, and we shall know no FUD!"
  • Barcamp Blackpool is looking for sponsors
  • Fab recently saw David Rovics live in Bonn — go to his gigs, he's awesome
  • Check out Ambjörn Elder’s blog, he spoke at OggCamp
  • Beer: Mary Ann Best Traditional Bitter & Betty Stogs Bitter — thanks to Kevan!

0:12:36 Releases and News

  • Mandriva 2011
  • Apache 2.2.20
  • GIMP 2.7.3
  • Is Intel dropping MeeGo too?
  • Oracle stops shipping Java for Linux
  • Amazon tablet probably coming in November
  • The Register hit by DNS hijack

0:43:03 Mini-Review: Podcatchers

Fab reviews his favourite podcatchers on the desktop, phone and tablet.

  • GPodder

  • Pocket Casts

  • BeyondPod for Honeycomb

0:57:42 Feedback

Supporters: Viridiana Mares, Axel Pahl, Evgeny Kuznetsov, Stuart Fawcett, Remy van Elst, David Megins-Nicholas and all the great people who flattr'ed us

  • Stuart Ward sent us a news story about Mojang selling their limited edition Minecraft Xperia play on eBay
  • MJJZF tells us about the Nordic Free Software Award, nominations are now open
  • x1101 sent us some responses to the OggCamp live show and more — we address these points
  • Stephen Michael Kellat recorded some stuff about network fragility also in reaction to our OggCamp discussion
  • Alison Chaiken, long time listener and Nokia insider, sends us some thoughts on desktops an mobile development

We had other emails from Yaroslav Halchenko, Gary Sellani, Lucas Nicolaus, Daniel Devine and Xavier Sythe.

  • Matthias Stürmer, who was a guest on Episode 212, mentions some courses on the OOXML improvements to Libre/OpenOffice
  • John Pinner says PyConUK is happening in Coventry on the weekend of September 24 & 25

Song: Liverpool by The Orchestra (all rights reserved, played by permission)

Copyright © 2011 Sixgun Productions — except where otherwise noted, this show and all its accompanying content is licensed under Creative Commons BY-SA 3.0.
item.author: linuxoutlaws@sixgun.org (Sixgun Productions)
item.itunes:subtitle: Released: September 16, 2011 Length: 1:22:15 More trouble in MeeGo land, Oracle stops distributing Java for Linux, rumours about the Amazon tablet, reviews of awesome podcatchers for your desktop, your phone and your tablet and much more. 0:01:32 Introdu
item.itunes:author: Sixgun Productions
item.itunes:summary: Released: September 16, 2011 Length: 1:22:15 More trouble in MeeGo land, Oracle stops distributing Java for Linux, rumours about the Amazon tablet, reviews of awesome podcatchers for your desktop, your phone and your tablet and much more. 0:01:32 Introduction Jules Mudkips came up with our new podcast slogan: “We podcast for Macragge, and we shall know no FUD!" Barcamp Blackpool is looking for sponsors Fab recently saw David Rovics live in Bonn — go to his gigs, he's awesome Check out Ambjörn Elder’s blog, he spoke at OggCamp Beer: Mary Ann Best Traditional Bitter & Betty Stogs Bitter — thanks to Kevan! 0:12:36 Releases and News Mandriva 2011 Apache 2.2.20 GIMP 2.7.3 Is Intel dropping MeeGo too? Oracle stops shipping Java for Linux Amazon tablet probably coming in November The Register hit by DNS hijack 0:43:03 Mini-Review: Podcatchers Fab reviews his favourite podcatchers on the desktop, phone and tablet. GPodder Pocket Casts BeyondPod for Honeycomb 0:57:42 Feedback Supporters: Viridiana Mares, Axel Pahl, Evgeny Kuznetsov, Stuart Fawcett, Remy van Elst, David Megins-Nicholas and all the great people who flattr'ed us Stuart Ward sent us a news story about Mojang selling their limited edition Minecraft Xperia play on eBay MJJZF tells us about the Nordic Free Software Award, nominations are now open x1101 sent us some responses to the OggCamp live show and more — we address these points Stephen Michael Kellat recorded some stuff about network fragility also in reaction to our OggCamp discussion Alison Chaiken, long time listener and Nokia insider, sends us some thoughts on desktops an mobile development We had other emails from Yaroslav Halchenko, Gary Sellani, Lucas Nicolaus, Daniel Devine and Xavier Sythe. Matthias Stürmer, who was a guest on Episode 212, mentions some courses on the OOXML improvements to Libre/OpenOffice John Pinner says PyConUK is happening in Coventry on the weekend of September 24 & 25 Song: Liverpool by The Orchestra (all rights reserved, played by permission) Copyright © 2011 Sixgun Productions — except where otherwise noted, this show and all its accompanying content is licensed under Creative Commons BY-SA 3.0.

item.title: Linux Outlaws 228 - For the Emperor!
item.description:
Released: September 10, 2011
Length: 1:43:09

This time on the show: Steve Jobs resigns, Fab joins the Space Marines, CmdrTaco throws the towel at Slashdot, Linux turns 20, kernel.org gets hacked and we interview John Graham-Cumming about The Geek Atlas and much more.


0:01:42 Introduction

  • Fab got addicted by Warhammer 40K again
  • Check out Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine

Fab started painting Space Marines again

  • Fallout: Nuka Break Episode 1
  • Visit our YouTube channel — we’ve been adding a lot of interesting stuff from OggCamp for the people who couldn’t be there
  • Brian is the dude who send us the mugs, he's been on the forum for ages

0:10:41 News

  • WikiLeaks leaks itself thanks to The Guardian
  • CmdrTaco resigns from Slashdot
  • Gnome 3 gets “web app mode”
  • Chrome turns three
  • Linux turns 20
  • kernel.org hacked
  • HP TouchPad still being produced and sold, Android/Ubuntu ports planned

0:52:54 Crapplewatch

  • Steve Jobs resigns

1:05:19 Interview: John Graham-Cumming

We interview John Graham-Cumming about The Geek Atlas, the Alan Turing petition he started some time back and all the other projects he has going on.

  • John's personal site
  • Charles Babbage
  • Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz
  • Security Now episodes with John: SN 199, SN 221

John Graham-Cumming

Song: Lies by Joe Ressington (all rights reserved, played by permission)

Copyright © 2011 Sixgun Productions — except where otherwise noted, this show and all its accompanying content is licensed under Creative Commons BY-SA 3.0.

item.title: Linux Outlaws 227 - Competitively Priced
item.description:
Released: September 4, 2011
Length: 1:33:49

In this episode, we get Randal Schwartz back on the show and interview him about Perl, FLOSS Weekly, podcasting in general, karaoke, cruises and his various programming gigs.


Please excuse the audio issues in part of the interview, we had to use a backup that turned out to be of sub-standard quality.

  • Last time we had Randal on was Episode 117
  • Randal is the host of FLOSS Weekly on the TWiT Network
  • Stonehenge, Randal's company
  • Randal wrote quite a few Perl books
  • Our "how to podcast" episode

Randal in the old TWiT studios

A slightly cut down video version of this interview is available on YouTube.

Song: Tanza Di Panza 77 by Won James Won from the album Les 120 Minuetes de... (licensed Creative Commons BY-NC-ND 2.0)

Copyright © 2011 Sixgun Productions — except where otherwise noted, this show and all its accompanying content is licensed under Creative Commons BY-SA 3.0.

item.title: Linux Outlaws 226 - Diggy Diggy Hole
item.description:
Released: August 31, 2011
Length: 1:36:01

We are finally back with a regular show and tons of news: Linus wants to fork Gnome, Samsung hires Cyanogen, Google buys Motorola, HP effectively kills themselves, Nokia is being stupid as well and Apple sues everybody.


0:01:09 Introduction

  • Loriot has died — Fab is really sad about this
  • Linux Outlaws video test
  • Leave Your Hat On intro, Leave Your Hat On Episode 1
  • We are now on Stitcher
  • LXnews has hit 500 posts
  • From the Desktop Summit: Hitler and Gnome 3, Panel about copyright assignment with Bradley Kuhn and Mark Shuttleworth
  • Bethesda wants to sue Mojang, Notch responds
  • The Kindle Cloud Reader
  • Check out the Itsawinner poker podcast

Loriot

0:20:10 Releases and News

  • Tiny Core Linux 3.8
  • Vine Linux 6.0
  • KNOPPIX 6.7
  • Oracle Linux 5.7
  • Gentoo Linux 11.2
  • Arch Linux 2011.08.19
  • Development Release: Fedora 16 Alpha
  • Mono 2.10.3
  • KDE 4.7
  • Samba 3.6
  • PyPy 1.6
  • Firefox 6
  • Bitcoin malware steals your GPU cycles for mining
  • Google+ gets games
  • Btrfs not default in F16
  • Linus wants Gnome to be forked
  • Samsung hires Cyanogen
  • Google buys Motorola
  • HP ditches PC business, kills WebOS
  • Nokia: MeeGo is dead, N9 not shipping in the US

1:09:33 Crapplewatch

  • Apple sues Samsung & Motorola over tablets, loses in the Netherlands

1:17:33 Feedback

Supporters: Kevan V., Daniel Lowe, Matthew Smith, Paul Williams  and all the flattr’ers

  • Xoke send us some great Yogscast-themed audio feedback
  • Russell Dickenson says we make too many jokes
  • Dan Devine weighs in on the Telstra vs Vodaphone "who is more crap" debate
  • Ed Vim sends us some comments including the fact that we need to have Becky Hogge on more often

We had more emails from Matthew Vita, Tom Sutch, Paul (from Chester LUG), Andrew, Kaheil, Michael Hanke, Alistair Munro and Cheezespread.

  • Fab is giving away Google+ invites in this blog post
  • MineCon: Las Vegas, 18-19 November
  • List with OggCamp 11 videos

Song:  Dwarf Hole (Diggy Diggy Hole) by Patient Zero (all rights reserved, played by permission)

Copyright © 2011 Sixgun Productions — except where otherwise noted, this show and all its accompanying content is licensed under Creative Commons BY-SA 3.0.

item.title: Linux Outlaws 225 - Chicken Herding (OggCamp 11 Recap)
item.description:
Released: August 30, 2011
Length: 1:01:48

In this installment of Linux Outlaws, Dan and Fab discuss their experience at OggCamp 11.


  • Photos OggCamp on Flickr
  • Video of Karen's talk Freedom: From My Heart to the Desktop
  • Video of Aq and Alan Bell breathing fire
  • Lanyrd site for OggCamp 11

Selected blog posts about OggCamp 11:

  • Becky Newborough
  • Alistair Munro
  • Tony Whitmore
  • Dan Lynch
  • Sam Tuke (from FSFE)
  • Marie Axelsson (from Flattr)

Joe Ressington's music — he performed live at the music event in the evening and has also made our Crapplewatch jingle.

The clay mugs from Lnx Tlws

Song: Drinking On My Own Again by Fit And The Conniptions from the album Bless Your Heart

Copyright © 2011 Sixgun Productions — except where otherwise noted, this show and all its accompanying content is licensed under Creative Commons BY-SA 3.0.
